events.title: Design Competition 2025

weeklyWorkshop.description: This week we explore the fundamentals of parametric design using Grasshopper for Rhino. Learn how to create complex geometric forms through algorithmic thinking and how to apply these techniques to real-world architectural projects. Topics include: data trees, components, parameters, and practical applications in facade design.

fbd.about: Freedom By Design (FBD) is a community service program that connects architecture students with community members in need of design services. Through FBD, students work on real projects that improve accessibility and quality of life for underserved populations. Our chapter is committed to using design as a tool for positive social change, working on projects that address barriers to accessibility in homes, schools, and community spaces.

events.title: Community Center Accessibility Project
events.description: Join us in designing accessibility improvements for a local community center. We'll work with community members to identify barriers and develop practical design solutions.

events.title: Residential Ramp Design Workshop
events.description: Learn how to design safe and accessible residential ramps. This hands-on workshop covers regulations, best practices, and construction details.

events.title: FBD Orientation Session
events.description: Introduction to Freedom By Design program, its mission, and how you can get involved. Learn about past projects and upcoming opportunities.
